trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_SEQ_00<tab>Tepeke is ready to tear down a false hero.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_SEQ_01<tab>The stage has been set for your final battle with Virazahn, for Tepeke informs you that the Radiant Host has arranged an arena in the mountain pass toward Khadga that is suitably epic in atmosphere. Word has been spread that you shall await him there, and Tepeke is confident that he will be unable to leave the challenge unanswered. She asks you to meet her at the Giantsgall Grounds, where the entrance to the pass is located.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_SEQ_02<tab>As Tepeke foresaw, you do not wait long until Virazahn appears. After a characteristically pompous speech, he draws his weapon and combat ensues. While the Perch of the Apex rains down massive stones from the sky, you and Tepeke manage to navigate the barrage and pummel Virazahn into submission. With your enemy beaten, the time is come to return to the Giantsgall Grounds.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_SEQ_03<tab>Sensing defeat closing in, Virazahn attempts to run, only to be knocked senseless by a rock falling from the sky. The Radiant Host soon arrives to take Virazahn away, and Tepeke reclaims her village's stolen treasure. She looks eager to share in this triumphant moment.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_SEQ_04<tab>With her mission complete, Tepeke expresses her desire to return home and bring the Perch of the Apex to its rightful place. Before she does, however, she must thank all those who helped her. She asks you to meet her at Tuliyollal, where her parents await, for a final farewell.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_SEQ_05<tab>You arrive at Xbalyav Ty'e before Tepeke does, and in the meantime relate all that happened to her proud parents. She joins the conversation soon after and makes a surprising suggestion that her people should learn how to use the perch safely instead of locking it away to be shrouded in legend again. While the feasibility of the prospect is still in question, Tepeke and Nettse are optimistic that the villagers will listen to the words of the one who succeeded in retrieving the treasure. Tepeke and her family say their farewells, and you hope that one day your paths may cross again.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Tepeke at the Giantsgall Grounds.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TODO_01<tab>Speak with Tepeke at the Giantsgall Grounds.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TODO_02<tab>Speak with Tepeke.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Tsuuhe at Tuliyollal.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_000<tab>You'll be pleased to know the Radiant Host were most helpful in finding a place fit for a duel. When I saw it, even I began to believe our encounter would be one for the songs.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_001<tab>Speaking of which, it seems your name is on the lips of all and sundry. The people already consider you the true savior of Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han, and believe you will bring Virazahn the deceitful to justice.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_002<tab>We apologize for putting so much weight on your shoulders, but something tells me you're used to it.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_003<tab>The final showdown shall take place in the mountain pass leading to Khadga, where great crystals will stand as witnesses to its conclusion. Suitably romantic, and suitably isolated.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_004<tab>The Radiant Host have spread word throughout Thavnair that a hero has arisen to challenge Virazahn, and his pride will force him to answer. The entrance to the pass is at the Giantsgall Grounds─let's head there at once to await his arrival!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_020<tab>Sramul here has opened the way towards Khadga. I'm certain Virazahn will arrive before long, and then we'll wipe that arrogant grin off his face!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_021<tab>But first, we should check our gear and gird our loins for battle. Are you ready, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_300<tab>There he is.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_VIRAZAHN_000_301<tab>Through the cragged peaks of Khadga, desolate winds blow over the field of battle... Oh, what a fitting location you have chosen for the conclusion of this legendary rivalry!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_VIRAZAHN_000_302<tab>I was right not to face you before, in environs unsuited to a struggle between titans. Now my patience has been rewarded, and my heart races in anticipation!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_303<tab>I knew you would answer our challenge. You would never be able to stomach the people calling you craven!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_VIRAZAHN_000_304<tab>Such boldness in the face of impending doom. Have you not realized by now that so long as I wield the Perch of the Apex, I am invincible?
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_305<tab>We'll soon put that to the test.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_306<tab>You rely too much upon stolen power─it deludes you. You claim to be a savior to the people, but they have seen through your lies. Even your own father can scarcely bear to look at you!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_307<tab>You're nothing but a small, small man, hiding within the hollow facade of a hero. And today we tear that facade down!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_VIRAZAHN_000_308<tab>Will you now? You may have the mettle, but have you puissance to claim the mantle of hero? <var 1A 02 /var>My<var 1A 01 /var> mantle!?
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_309<tab>The time for words is passed. Follow my lead!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_100_350<tab>He's out cold. Now to take back the treasure...
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_VIRAZAHN_000_350<tab>What... This...this can't happen! A hero...never falls...
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_VIRAZAHN_100_350<tab>I must retreat... Yes, a tactical retreat... A noble retreat! So that the Justiciar may live to save another day!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_VIRAZAHN_000_351<tab>Huh...?
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_353<tab>I suppose the apex wasn't finished yet.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_354<tab>And it seems that Virazahn, in his cowardly haste, neglected to look skyward. Was it an unfortunate accident?
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_355<tab>Or fate delivering his just deserts?

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_358<tab>He claimed to be Radz<var 1F /var>at<var 1F /var>Han's savior, yet he sowed only discontent among its people. Perhaps some days in a sunless gaol will give him time to reflect upon the error of his ways.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_359<tab>And now, I've finally recovered the Perch of the Apex. Thank you for coming this far with me, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_380<tab>The battle was hard-fought, but we made it through. Virazahn is the responsibility of the Radiant Host, now.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_381<tab>And now that I've done what I pledged to do, I must return home and bring the good tidings to my mother and father!

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_382<tab>Yet before doing so, there are many others I must thank. In the meantime, can I count on you to meet my family at Tuliyollal for one final farewell? My parents will surely be glad to see you again.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_000_400<tab>Why, if it isn't <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>! I'm pleased to say I've quite recovered since last we met. Perhaps one day, I'll have the chance to save <var 1A 02 /var>you<var 1A 01 /var> in return!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TSUUHE_000_420<tab>I didn't expect to see you in Tuliyollal again so soon. Is Tepeke well?
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TSUUHE_000_440<tab>She really did it! And the man who stole our sacred treasure will answer for his deeds.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_441<tab>Father! Mother! It's good to see you!

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_442<tab>I'm sure <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>'s already told you what happened. I couldn't have retrieved our treasure without <var 08 E905 ((her)) ((him)) /var>!
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_000_443<tab>So we've heard. Yet <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> also told us your wits and bravery were essential to your success.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_000_444<tab>On behalf of our whole village, I thank you for guiding Tepeke in her quest, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_000_445<tab>Now the Perch of the Apex must be returned, and put under careful guard once again.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_000_446<tab>The story of the tural vidraal's demise proves that we are not meant to wield its power as our own.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_447<tab>I'm sorry, Father, but I disagree. Once I return to the village, I want to tell everyone what happened in Thavnair. They need to know what the treasure is capable of, or else we risk forgetting once again.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_448<tab>I won't deny that the apex's power is dangerous. I saw with my own eyes what happens when it's wielded with abandon.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_100_448<tab>Yet during the course of our search I also saw potential. If we fully understood how it worked, we could use it without risk to ourselves or other people.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_101_448<tab>We could turn something we once feared to our advantage, instead of letting it become obscured in legend.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_102_448<tab>I can see the reason in that. We must be ever ready for danger, even in times of peace. Should our safety be threatened, the treasure may grant us a means to protect ourselves.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_103_448<tab>But can we be trusted to use it responsibly? Great power breeds great desire...someone with the same ambitions as Virazahn may arise again, perhaps from among our own.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_104_448<tab>I daresay that once I've regaled them with the rise and fall of the Justiciar, they'll think twice before following in his misguided footsteps!

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_105_448<tab>As our forebears relied on the legend of the tural vidraal's fate to forbid the treasure's use, we can rely on the story of Virazahn's fate to urge caution. And this time we have someone who lived through it to tell the tale!

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_106_448<tab>Of course, if I'm going to be guiding people in safe use of a potentially dangerous treasure, I see no choice but to inherit my father's position as its guardian.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_449<tab>Some may raise their eyebrows at the prospect of loose-lipped Tepeke serving as the Perch of the Apex's protector, but I've grown from my mistakes.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_450<tab>And who better to tell the tale of Virazahn's and Tepeke's failures?

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_000_451<tab>Your only mistake was in trusting Virazahn, the same as I and many others. But unlike him, you have the willpower to overcome your own failings. Over the course of your long and arduous journey, you gained a wealth of experiences, and your efforts have finally been rewarded.

TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_NETTSE_100_451<tab>You took responsibility for your actions, and by so doing proved your conviction to our people. They shall listen to this proposition with open minds, I am certain.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_452<tab>Now we must say farewell, as much as it pains me to do so. I owe you a debt I could never hope to repay.
TEXT_KINGBA551_04847_TEPEKE_000_453<tab>Once I return to the village, I'll do my utmost to protect the treasure we worked so hard to retrieve. Until next we meet, may fortune smile upon you!
